variant.title: Words: Evaluative, Emotional, Colourful, Musical!
variant.author: Saif M. Mohammad
variant.address: 1200 Montreal Road, Building M-50 Ottawa, Ontario K1A 0R6, Canada
variant.bodyText: Abstract of the talk Beyond literal meaning, words have associations with sentiment, emotion, colour, and even music. Identifying such associations is of substantial ben- efit for information visualization, data sonifica- tion, and sentiment analysis, which in turn have applications in commerce, education, art, and health. I will present methods to generate high- coverage resources that capture such associations. I will show how these resources can be used for analyzing emotions in text, detecting personality from essays, and generating music from novels. Finally, I will show how word-sentiment associa- tion lexicons have helped create the top-ranking systems in recent SemEval competitions on the sentiment analysis of social media posts.
